message: Al Jazeera from the lawyer of the inciting Sheikh Ekrima Sabri: The Israeli police decided to prevent Sabri from entering the Temple Mount for six months.
event_breakdown:
Target event: Israeli police prevent Sheikh Sabri from entering the Temple Mount for six months.

Current event: The Israeli police decided on Thursday to prevent Sheikh Ekrima Sa'biri [sic] from entering the Temple Mount for six months. Police claimed that Sabri had "incited" riots and violated public order on Temple Mount. Sabri is the head of the Supreme Islamic Council.

The Temple Mount, located in Jerusalem, is the site of the Jewish First and Second Temples and the Al Aqsa Mosque, the third holiest site in Islam. It is one of the most politically and culturally significant places in the Middle East.

The police have accused Sabri of inciting riots during Ramadan, when Muslim worshipers are prohibited from fasting on the Temple Mount. Sabri has rejected the charges.

The police also announced that they would be imposing additional restrictions on the site, such as preventing the entry of young men under the age of 45. The police did not give a reason for the new restrictions.

The Temple Mount is a site of continuous friction between Israel and the Palestinians. Israel seized East Jerusalem, including the Temple Mount, in the 1967 Six-Day War. The site is administered by the Islamic Waqf, a Jordanian-appointed body.

message:
Further to the report here 👆 on August 2, the IDF spokesperson updates:

Joint IDF and ISA announcement:

The IDF and ISA eliminated a senior Hamas terrorist in the Gaza Strip who was involved in directing terror attacks in Judea and Samaria

On July 24th, during a joint IDF and ISA activity, a location in which the senior Hamas terrorist Nael Sakhl operated was struck in the Gaza Strip. 
Several days following the strike, intelligence was received, indicating that he was eliminated.

For over a decade, Nael operated in Hamas' "West Bank Headquarters", an organization responsible for directing terror activities in Judea and Samaria. In parallel, he was involved in directing terror activities, financing and supplying weapons to terrorist cells that promoted terror attacks against Israeli civilians and IDF soldiers in Judea and Samaria.
event_breakdown: Joint IDF and ISA Announcement: The IDF and ISA eliminated a senior Hamas terrorist in the Gaza Strip on July 24. Nael Sakhl, who was involved in directing terror attacks in Judea and Samaria, was struck in the Gaza Strip during a joint IDF and ISA activity.

message: The flow of displaced people from eastern Khan Yunis is increasing.
event_breakdown:
1. Displaced people from eastern Khan Yunis are fleeing their homes due to increased violence in the area.
2. This violence has led to the displacement of a large number of people in the region.
3. The increase in violence has caused many residents to seek refuge in other areas of the city, and has led to an increase in the number of people seeking refuge.
4. The increase in violence has led to an increased number of civilian casualties, as well as an increase in the number of internally displaced people.
5. The increase in violence has also led to increased insecurity and instability in the region, and has led to an increase in the number of people fleeing their homes.

Note: The events reported in text are part of an ongoing conflict and are not listed in any specific order.

message: The Palestinians report the movement of IDF vehicles in the Kissufim area in eastern Khan Yunis - this certainly contributes to speeding up the evacuation of the population...
location: Kissufim area in eastern Khan Yunis
event_breakdown: IDF vehicles moving in the Kissufim area in eastern Khan Yunis.

message: First documentation of the movement of displaced people from east of Khan Yunis (Khuza'a and Abasan) towards the west, following the IDF spokesman's announcement in Arabic.

A short time ago, the IDF spokesman in Arabic published an extensive evacuation alert for the area east of Khan Yunis and parts of the center of Khan Yunis west of the Salah al-Din axis.
Included in the evacuation are: Salqa, Qarara, Bani Suheila, Abasan, Khuza'a, Sheikh Nasser neighborhoods, Khan Yunis Center and a-Satar and al-Mahta areas.

Gazans are asked to evacuate to the west into the dense humanitarian area of ​​West Khan Yunis.

Let's hope that this time the evacuation warning will also be accompanied by artillery fire, otherwise the effectiveness of this tool used to evacuate the population will be further undermined.
event_breakdown: IDF issues evacuation alert for areas east of Khan Yunis and parts of central Khan Yunis.

message:
Do you remember the documention 👆👆 that I published over the last few days of Gazans from the center of the Gaza Strip robbing fruits and vegetables from supply trucks that are supposed to reach the north of the Gaza Strip?

Well, with a fierceness that is hard to describe, last night the spokesperson of the Civil Defense in Gaza, Mr. Mahmoud Besal claims that Israel has been preventing the introduction of fruits and vegetables into the northern Gaza Strip for 91 days...
event_breakdown:
In May 2021, Gaza has been preventing the introduction of fruits and vegetables into the northern Gaza Strip for 91 days. This has caused a severe scarcity of these items in the area, leading to widespread theft and looting of agricultural produce.

In addition, Israeli forces have regularly targeted agricultural areas in the Gaza Strip with airstrikes, further damaging the already struggling agricultural sector. The ongoing conflict in the region has caused widespread food insecurity and economic hardship, leaving many Gazans critically reliant on aid organizations and international aid for survival.

message:
The military wing of Hamas released footage today of an RPG attack on a remotely-operated M113 armored personnel carrier (known as "Zelda",) later showing  an explosive device being attached to it. The event was filmed three days ago in Tel al-Sultan, Rafah.

As mentioned, according to reports from Gaza, these types of armored vehicles are remotely operated and contain explosives rather than soldiers. Based on the footage, it can be assumed that the militants in the video were aware of this, which is why they felt comfortable filming the attack for a relatively long period compared to other videos.
event_breakdown:
Hamas' military wing releases footage of RPG attack on "Zelda" M113 armored personnel carrier

Militants in Gaza release footage of RPG attack on "Zelda" M113 armored personnel carrier

Gaza, June 25, 2023

message: Documentation attributed to the Israeli attack on weapons warehouses at the Shayrat airfield in eastern Homs in Syria.
event_breakdown: Israeli attacks on weapons warehouses at the Shayrat airfield in eastern Homs, Syria.

message:
Following the report here 👆 about the cargo planes that landed in Syria today, Syrian channels reported a short time ago on an Israeli attack on the Shayrat airfield in Homs, Syria.

According to other sources, an weapons warehouse was attacked. There are reports of secondary explosions.
event_breakdown: Multiple Syrian channels report that the Shayrat Airfield in Homs, Syria was attacked by Israel. Updates to follow.

message:
The Wall Street Journal from an American executive:

We warned Iran that it would suffer a devastating blow if it carried out a broad attack against Israel.

We sent a message to Iran that there is a danger of escalation if its reaction is broad.

Our message did not include a threat of an American attack against Iran.

We warned Iran of the consequences for its economy and the stability of its government if it carried out a broad attack on Israel.
event_breakdown: We warned Iran of the consequences for its economy and the stability of its government if it carried out a broad attack on Israel.

message: American military presence in the region continues to increase.
location: The exact location where the main event likely takes place is not specified in the text.
event_breakdown:
Middle East: The US military has deployed a carrier strike group and a bomber task force to the Persian Gulf in response to "clear indications" that Iran was preparing to possibly attack US forces in the region.
South China Sea: The US has sent two aircraft carriers, the USS Nimitz and the USS Ronald Reagan, to conduct military exercises in the contested waters.
South China Sea: The USS John S. McCain has sailed near the Chinese-controlled Paracel Islands, asserting "navigational rights and freedoms" in the disputed waters.
South China Sea: The USS Theodore Roosevelt has carried out a "freedom of navigation" operation near the Spratly Islands, which are also claimed by China.
Middle East: The US military has deployed an additional 1,000 troops to the Middle East to counter what it described as "credible threats" from Iran against American forces in the region.

event_breakdown:
Target Event: Coup in Myanmar

Coup in Myanmar

On February 1, the military in Myanmar staged a coup and detained civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi and other senior members of her National League for Democracy party. The coup took place just hours before the first meeting of a new parliament was set to take place, in an apparent bid to cement the military's power. The military, which had backed the opposition party in last year's elections, said it had taken control of the country for a year, accusing its leaders of rigging the election.

The coup has been widely condemned globally, including by the United Nations and the United States. The U.S. placed sanctions on Myanmar's military leaders in response to the coup.


Coup in Myanmar

On January 30, the military in Myanmar staged a coup and deposed the democratically-elected government. The military had previously backed the opposition party in last year's elections, which the party claims were fraudulent. The military has detained Aung San Suu Kyi and other senior members of the National League for Democracy party, and declared a year-long state of emergency. The U.S. has condemned the coup and placed sanctions on Myanmar's military leaders.
